about.title: A bit about what I do
about.p1: I don't just write code; from a very young age I was building my own programs and learning on my own. Over time, I decided to dedicate my career to software development, deepening my knowledge and improving every day.
about.p2: What started as small, self-taught programs in my childhood gradually evolved into more complex and challenging projects. Each challenge taught me how to solve problems practically and understand how to connect frontend and backend so that everything works together as a coherent whole.

projects.title: Selected work
projects.subtitle: A showcase of my completed projects, technical experiments, and contributions.

trickyMansion.description: A 2D platformer game developed in Unity. Features a random vertical scrolling level generation, various enemies and traps. It has been showcased at several game development events and is published on platforms like Google Play and Itch.io.

pseudoBlocks.description: Visual programming environment built from scratch with C# WinForms. Includes a custom lexer/parser for interpreting block logic.

clumsyMimics.description: Award-winning Game Jam entry created in 48h. Focuses on rapid prototyping and polished mechanic feel.

scrollCarousel.description: Open-source Unity UI component providing high-performance, inertia-based scrolling for canvas elements.

superMarioPhaser.description: Browser-based recreation of the classic using Phaser 3. Demonstrates JS physics engines and tilemap management.

spaceInvaders.description: Low-level console implementation focusing on memory management and rendering loop optimization.

jokerAssistant.description: Desktop voice assistant integrating Microsoft Speech API for command recognition and automation.
